questions.q: What is the minimum monthly wage in Malaysia from Aug 2025?
questions.explain: Correct: From 1 Aug 2025, the minimum monthly wage is RM1,700 (Legal IDs 32–34). Other figures are outdated/wrong.

questions.q: Maximum weekly working hours allowed?
questions.explain: Correct: 45 hours per week is the limit (Legal ID 15). More than this is unlawful except within OT rules.

questions.q: Scenario: Your employer keeps your passport for “safety”. Is this legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Employers cannot keep workers’ passports; only proper authority can (Legal ID 35).

questions.q: How many paid public holidays must you get each year?
questions.explain: Correct: At least 11 paid public holidays, including 5 mandatory ones (Legal ID 70).

questions.q: What is the maximum monthly overtime limit?
questions.explain: Correct: Overtime is capped at 104 hours/month (Legal ID 1).

questions.q: Scenario: You worked 5 continuous hours without a break. Is this allowed?
questions.explain: Correct: A 30-minute break is required after 5 continuous hours (Legal ID 15).

questions.q: Maximum wage deduction allowed per month?
questions.explain: Correct: Total deductions cannot exceed 50% of monthly wages (Legal ID 9).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer didn’t pay wages for 2 months. What should happen?
options: It’s an offence; court can order payment
questions.explain: Correct: Non-payment is an offence; authorities/courts can order payment and penalties (Legal IDs 26–30).

questions.q: How often must wages be paid?
questions.explain: Correct: Wages must be paid at least once a month (Legal ID 4).

questions.q: Wages must be paid within how many days after the wage period ends?
questions.explain: Correct: Within 7 days after the wage period ends (Legal ID 6).

questions.q: Scenario: You worked half a month. How is pay calculated?
options: Monthly ÷ Days in period × Days worked
questions.explain: Correct: Pay = Monthly wages ÷ Days in period × Days actually worked (Legal ID 5).

questions.q: Minimum daily wage (6-day week) from Aug 2025?
questions.explain: Correct: RM65.38 for 6-day week (Legal IDs 32–34).

questions.q: If wages are not paid on time, what is it?
questions.explain: Correct: Failing to pay wages on time is an offence (Legal ID 29).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer pays wages in cash at a bar. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Payment at bars/shops is prohibited (Legal ID 14).

questions.q: Can employers charge interest on wage advances?
questions.explain: Correct: Charging interest or fees on wage advances is not allowed (Legal ID 13).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer fails to pay maternity allowance. What happens?
questions.explain: Correct: Courts can order payment and penalties for violations (Legal ID 74).

questions.q: Maximum daily hours allowed (normal conditions)?
questions.explain: Correct: 8 hours/day (Legal ID 15).

questions.q: Maximum weekly hours allowed?
questions.explain: Correct: 45 hours/week (Legal ID 15).

questions.q: What break is required after 5 continuous hours?
questions.explain: Correct: At least a 30-minute break (Legal ID 15).

questions.q: Scenario: Forced to work every weekly rest day. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: At least one rest day per week is mandatory (Legal ID 20).

questions.q: How many rest days per week are you entitled to?
questions.explain: Correct: At least one full rest day weekly (Legal ID 20).

questions.q: Scenario: You apply to employer for flexible work. Allowed?
questions.explain: Correct: Workers may apply for flexible hours/days/place (Legal ID 25).

questions.q: What’s the emergency daily maximum hours?
questions.explain: Correct: 12 hours/day cap in emergencies (Legal ID 15).

questions.q: Scenario: You worked 50 hours in a week. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Exceeds 45 hours/week (Legal ID 15).

questions.q: Can your employer keep your passport?
questions.explain: Correct: Employers cannot hold passports; only proper authority can (Legal ID 35).

questions.q: Maximum fine for general labour violations (no specific penalty stated)?
questions.explain: Correct: Up to RM50,000 (Legal ID 31).

questions.q: Scenario: No safety helmet provided on site. Who is responsible?
questions.explain: Correct: Employer must provide protective equipment (Legal ID 41).

questions.q: A safety & health committee is required at how many workers?
questions.explain: Correct: Required for ≥ 40 workers or when directed (Legal ID 44).

questions.q: Scenario: Unsafe electrical wiring in hostel. Who must fix it?
questions.explain: Correct: Employer/accommodation provider must ensure safety (Legal ID 56/63).

questions.q: Who must report workplace accidents/dangerous incidents?
questions.explain: Correct: Employer must notify the nearest OSH office (Legal ID 45).

questions.q: Scenario: Hostel has no water supply. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Adequate water must be provided (Legal ID 63).

questions.q: Employees’ safety duty includes…
options: Care for own & others’ safety and follow rules
questions.explain: Correct: Workers must take reasonable care and wear PPE; penalties apply for breaches (Legal ID 42).

questions.q: What is the maximum overtime hours per month?
questions.explain: Correct: Monthly cap is 104 hours (Legal ID 1).

questions.q: Who must pay for overtime, rest-day, and holiday work?
questions.explain: Correct: Employer must pay; non-payment is an offence (Legal ID 2).

questions.q: Fine for general violations if no specific penalty is stated?
questions.explain: Correct: Up to RM50,000 (Legal ID 31).

questions.q: Scenario: You worked 120 OT hours this month. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Exceeds the 104-hour cap (Legal ID 1).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer refuses to pay OT. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Non-payment is an offence; court can order payment (Legal ID 2).

questions.q: If no penalty is specified for an offence, what applies?
questions.explain: Correct: General penalty up to RM50,000 (Legal ID 31).

questions.q: Scenario: You worked on a public holiday but got no extra pay. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Employers must pay for holiday work (Legal ID 2).

questions.q: What happens if an employer ignores a payment order?
questions.explain: Correct: Non-compliance can lead to extra fines until payment (Legal ID 26).

questions.q: Minimum overtime pay rate is…
questions.explain: Correct: At least 1.5× the normal hourly rate (Legal ID 16).

questions.q: If you work more than half a rest day, you get…
questions.explain: Correct: More than half rest-day work = 2 days’ wages (Legal ID 22).

questions.q: Hourly rate calculation (monthly basis) is…
questions.explain: Correct: Monthly ÷ 26 (or weekly ÷ 6) (Legal ID 24).

questions.q: Scenario: Paid normal rate for overtime. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: OT must be paid at least 1.5× (Legal ID 16).

questions.q: Scenario: Worked half a rest day. What pay?
questions.explain: Correct: Half rest-day work = 1 day’s wages (Legal ID 22).

questions.q: Scenario: Worked full rest day. What pay?
questions.explain: Correct: Full rest-day work = 2 days’ wages (Legal ID 22).

questions.q: Scenario: Overtime on a rest day. What pay?
questions.explain: Correct: OT on rest day must be at least double hourly rate (Legal ID 22).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer calculates hourly rate as monthly ÷ 30. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Must use monthly ÷ 26 (Legal ID 24).

questions.q: If you live at the workplace for ≥ 6 months, the land for food must be at least…
questions.explain: Correct: 250 square meters (Legal ID 47).

questions.q: If ≥100 workers live at site, employer must provide…
questions.explain: Correct: Community hall and recreation facilities are required (Legal ID 48).

questions.q: If no hospital is nearby, who must establish a clinic?
questions.explain: Correct: Employer must maintain a clinic with doctor visits (Legal ID 50).

questions.q: Must accommodation have a certificate?
questions.explain: Correct: Certificate for Accommodation is required (Legal ID 52).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer charges rent but not via wage deductions. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Rent/charges must be deducted via wages under prescribed conditions (Legal ID 55).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer uses an unfit building for housing. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Unfit buildings cannot be used for accommodation (Legal ID 56).

questions.q: Which utilities are required for housing?
questions.explain: Correct: Adequate water and electricity must be provided (Legal ID 63).

questions.q: Scenario: Terminated with notice < 4 weeks; told to leave hostel today. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Worker generally has up to 4 weeks to vacate after short-notice termination (Legal ID 59).

questions.q: Employer safety duties include…
options: Provide safe equipment and systems, training, emergency procedures
questions.explain: Correct: Employers must ensure safety, training, safe systems, facilities, and emergency procedures (Legal ID 41).

questions.q: Employees must…
options: Care for own & others’ safety and wear PPE
questions.explain: Correct: Workers must cooperate on safety and wear PPE; penalties apply for breaches (Legal ID 42).

questions.q: Penalty for breaking employee safety duties?
options: RM2,000 fine or up to 3 months jail
questions.explain: Correct: Fines up to RM2,000 or jail up to 3 months (Legal ID 42).

questions.q: When must a safety & health committee be set up?
questions.explain: Correct: Required for 40 or more workers or if directed (Legal ID 44).

questions.q: Who must report accidents/dangerous incidents?
questions.explain: Correct: Employer must notify the nearest OSH office (Legal ID 45).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer ignores fire safety. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Employers must take fire safety measures (Legal ID 38).

questions.q: Employer must prepare and update…
questions.explain: Correct: A written safety and health policy must be prepared and communicated (Legal ID 43).

questions.q: Scenario: Infectious disease outbreak at work. Employer must…
options: Provide segregation and pay costs as directed
Ask workers to stay home without pay
questions.explain: Correct: Provide place for safe segregation and bear maintenance/treatment costs as directed (Legal ID 46).

questions.q: Maternity leave entitlement (days)?
questions.explain: Correct: 98 consecutive days; allowance subject to qualifying conditions (Legal ID 66).

questions.q: Paternity leave entitlement (days)?
questions.explain: Correct: 7 consecutive days for eligible married male employees (Legal ID 73).

questions.q: Minimum paid public holidays per year?
questions.explain: Correct: At least 11 paid public holidays (Legal ID 70).

questions.q: Annual leave for service ≥ 5 years?
questions.explain: Correct: 16 days per 12 months (Legal ID 71).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer refuses maternity leave to an eligible worker. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: It’s an offence; court can order payment/penalties (Legal ID 74).

questions.q: Scenario: You work on a rest day > half normal hours. Compensation?
questions.explain: Correct: Compensation depends on pay basis; exceeding half normal hours triggers higher pay (Legal ID 69).

questions.q: Scenario: Public holiday falls on your rest day. What happens?
options: Next working day becomes a paid holiday
questions.explain: Correct: Next working day becomes a paid public holiday (Legal ID 70).

questions.q: Sick leave entitlement for < 2 years of service?
questions.explain: Correct: 14 days per year; higher entitlements for longer service/hospitalisation (Legal ID 72).

questions.q: Can an employer legally keep your passport?
questions.explain: Correct: Employers cannot keep passports; only proper authority can (Legal ID 35).

questions.q: Who may lawfully hold your passport?
options: You and immigration authority with legal approval
questions.explain: Correct: Only the worker or proper authority (Legal ID 35).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer keeps passport for 'safekeeping' until contract ends. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Still illegal; passport must remain with worker (Legal ID 35).

questions.q: If your passport is kept illegally, that is…
questions.explain: Correct: It is unlawful (Legal ID 35).

questions.q: Penalty that can apply for passport/labour violations (when no specific penalty stated)?
questions.explain: Correct: General penalty up to RM50,000 (Legal ID 31).

questions.q: Scenario: You 'agree' to let employer hold passport. Is it safe/legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Workers should keep their own passport; employer retention risks coercion and is not permitted (Legal ID 35).

questions.q: Scenario: Employer returns your passport only for immigration appointments. Legal?
questions.explain: Correct: Passport should remain with the worker except when handed to proper authority (Legal ID 35).

questions.q: If employer refuses to return your passport, what should you do first?
options: Pay a fee to get it back
questions.explain: Correct: Seek help from NGOs/authorities; retention is illegal (Legal ID 35).
